ai.summary: Hoxne Heritage Walk is an 8.4 km moderate route in Suffolk, UK, weaving through farmland, hedgerows, and historic sites around Hoxne. The route suits walkers with some experience and offers scenic countryside, village lanes, and gentle elevation changes.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain combines tarmac lanes, compact country paths, grassy field tracks, and occasional stiles. Ground can be muddy after rain. Elevation is generally gentle with a few short ascents.
ai.safety_notes: Plan the walk during daylight hours and check weather forecasts. Wear sturdy boots and carry a map or device with offline mapping. Expect uneven surfaces, gates and stiles, and occasional busy rural roads; keep to the paths, close gates behind you, and supervise children or dogs. Stay aware of livestock and other trail users; carry a charged mobile phone for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map or offline map on a phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring, Summer, and Autumn; winter trips are possible with appropriate clothing and traction.

seo.title: Hoxne Heritage Walk – 8.4 km Moderate Trail in Suffolk, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Hoxne Heritage Walk, an 8.4 km moderate route through Suffolk's countryside and historic sites around Hoxne. Practical tips, terrain notes, best seasons, and gear.
